articles.title: Hidden History: The Vigenere Cipher
articles.author: Lenny Flank
articles.summary: The Vigenere Cipher is an encryption system that was developed over 500 years ago. It was still being used by Soviet KGB spies in the 1950s. Julius Caesar encrypted his military communications using a system that is today referred to as a'single substitution cipher'. In the middle of the 15th century, Giovan Battista Bellaso made a significant improvement on the Caesar cipher. The system was further modified in the late 16th century by a Frenchman named Blaise de Vigeere.
